Supervisory Operations Research Analyst

LinQuest Customer Site, USA, Reston, 12300 Sunrise Valley Dr., Virginia, United States

Full Time Entry-level / Junior USD 185K - 210K

KBR, Inc.

View all jobs at KBR, Inc.

Apply now Apply later

Posted 21 hours ago

Title:

Supervisory Operations Research Analyst

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR‚Äôs National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country‚Äôs most critical role ‚Äì protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

  • Innovative Projects: KBR‚Äôs work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

  • Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

  • Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

List the main duties and responsibilities of the position, using bullet points for clarity. Focus on the most exciting and impactful aspects of the job.

  • KBR is seeking a Supervisory Operations Research Analyst to lead a team of quantitative analysts and modelers dedicated to conduct modeling, simulation, and analysis (MS&A) of emerging concepts for the Defense Advanced Projects Research Agency (DARPA) using advanced MS&A techniques and tools.

  • Directly engage with DARPA and other government stakeholders to determine analytic requirements, deliverables, and study milestones and schedules.

  • Manage the team's timely execution of the study plan(s) and ensure timely development of quality products.

  • Lead the conduct of studies for senior-level military decision makers, technology developers, and acquisition professionals for use in CONOPS development, force structure design, resource allocation, and targeted technology insertion.

  • Develop, implement, and execute an experiment design approach, identify key metrics for simulation output, analyze results, generate insights and information, and present findings to senior DoD leaders.

  • Conduct pre- and post-simulation analyses as needed.

  • Provide technical direction to subordinate analysts and modelers to execute tasks on schedule and to exercise quality control over study deliverables.

  • Develop and/or instantiate platform and system models, model behaviors, and model hierarchies in the designated modeling & simulation (M&S) environment.

  • Exercise supervisory and performance evaluation responsibilities.

Work Environment:

  • Location: On-site

  • Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%

  • Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in operations research, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, or related discipline

  • 12 years of relevant experience, including a minimum of 8 years of MS&A experience and 3 years of management experience

  • Strong knowledge of simulation analysis and experiment design & analysis techniques

  • Skilled in R, MATLAB, Python, JupyterLab and/or Jupyter Notebook

Desired:

  • PhD in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, or related discipline.

  • 15 yrs. of relevant experience, including a minimum of 10 years of MS&A experience and 5 years of management experience

  • Project Management Professional (PMP) or Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) or equivalent certification

  • Deep knowledge of simulation analysis and experiment design & analysis techniques

  • Expertise in R, MATLAB, Python, JupyterLab and/or Jupyter Notebook

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40hrs

Basic Compensation:

$185,000-$210,000

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate‚Äôs knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you‚Äôre excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability, and our Zero Harm culture.

These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of team‚Äôs philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient, and safer.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Apply now Apply later
